articles.author: Kristina Killgrove
articles.title: 'An extreme end of human genetic variation': Ancient humans were isolated in southern Africa for nearly 100,000 years, and their genetics are stunningly different - Live Science
articles.description: Ancient genomes from southern Africa show that people evolved in isolation for upward of 100,000 years.
articles.content:
Humans were isolated in southern Africa for about 100,000 years, which caused them to "fall outside the range of genetic variation" seen in modern-day people, a new genetic study reveals.
